Body:
Description: Hi Team,

We have observed that the AIC console is not working as expected. We can see only reports but not the folders and their permissions view on WEB as it throws error as Page can,t be displayed. Request you to please set up a call and provide solution for the same.

Mr Saqib Sharif the Technical Engineer has seen this error, so request you to please assign to him as his work timing is similar to mine.

Thanks and Regards,

Praveen V.Huilgol.
Next Steps Updated: Awaiting customer response now

What We've Learned Updated: During meeting on ticket 00438781, customer mentioned that the SSL certificate got expired for AIC and they replaced it. Since then, the AIC is inaccessible. I have shared the KB links to both Reporting Module and AIC for HTTPs.
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Install/Application/Reports/Secure.htm

https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/AIC_11.6/page/Content/Access/InformationCenter/Installation/Secure.htm
Steps to Reproduce Updated: This is unclear on what setting has been changed by the client so cant clearly share steps to reproduce.
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Saqib Sharif, Praveen Huilgol
Next Steps Updated: Issue stands resolved. Closing ticket.

What We've Learned Updated: During meeting on ticket 00438781, customer mentioned that the SSL certificate got expired for AIC and they replaced it. Since then, the AIC is inaccessible. I have shared the KB links to both Reporting Module and AIC for HTTPs.
https://helpcenter.netwrix.com/bundle/EnterpriseAuditor_11.6/page/Content/EnterpriseAuditor/Install/Application/Reports/Secure.htm

------------------------------------------
07/05/2025:

It was observed during troubleshooting that AIC was configured to open via HTTPs on port 443 but in IIS there was no certificate assigned to it.

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Step 1: Configure SSL settings in webservice.config and web.config (SA & AIC v11.5 only).
Step 2: Do not attach SSL certificate to binding ports in IIS.
